title: Bubble Sort
description: Bubble sort repeatedly steps through the list, compares adjacent elements, and swaps them if they are in the wrong order. The process is repeated until the list is sorted.
keyPoints: Simple but inefficient for large datasets.
Stable sort (does not change the relative order of equal elements).
Adaptive: can stop early if no swaps are made in a pass.
pseudocode:
1. Repeat for each element in the array.
2. Compare each pair of adjacent elements.
3. Swap if out of order.
4. Repeat until no swaps are needed.
